Container.Name: FileBot
Container.Overview: FileBot is the ultimate tool for organizing and renaming your movies, tv shows or anime, and music well as downloading subtitles and artwork. It's smart and just works. [br][br] The GUI of the application is accessed through a modern web browser (no installation or configuration needed on the client side) or via any VNC client. Also, being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small (less than 215MB in download size). [br][br][span][/span] For a complete documentation of this container, see [a href="https://github.com/jlesage/docker-filebot/blob/master/README.md"] https://github.com/jlesage/docker-filebot/blob/master/README.md[/a].

Config.Name: Config Directory
Config.Description: This is where the application stores its configuration, log and any files needing persistency.<br>Container path: /config

Config.Name: Storage
Config.Description: This location contains files from your host that need to be accessible by the application.<br>Container path: /storage

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Watch Directory
Config.Description: This is the input folder of the Automated Media Center (AMC) script. Any media copied to this folder will be processed by the script.<br>Container path: /watch

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Output Directory
Config.Description: This is the output folder of the Automated Media Center (AMC) script. This is where medias are located once they are renamed and organized.<br>Container path: /output

Config.Name: User ID
Config.Description: ID of the user the application runs as.

Config.Name: Group ID
Config.Description: ID of the group the application runs as.

Config.Name: Umask
Config.Description: Mask that controls how file permissions are set for newly created files. The value of the mask is in octal notation.

Config.Name: Niceness (priority)
Config.Description: Priority at which the application should run. A niceness value of -20 is the highest priority and 19 is the lowest priority.<br><b>NOTE:</b> Setting a negative value requires additional permissions. Thus, <i><b>--cap-add=SYS_NICE</b></i> must be added in <i>Extra Parameters</i> (shown when <i>Advanced View</i> is enabled).

Config.Name: Display Width
Config.Description: Width (in pixels) of the application's window.

Config.Name: Display Height
Config.Description: Height (in pixels) of the application's window.

Config.Name: Secure Connection
Config.Description: Whether or not an encrypted connection should be used to access the application's GUI. Set to <i><b>1</b></i> to encrypt the connection.<br><span style='color: red;'><b>Note:</b></span> When enabling the secure connection, security parameters needs to be generated. This <b>one-time</b> operation is done during container startup. Depending on your system, this could take a few minutes. GUI of the application won't be available until the operation completes.

Config.Name: Extra x11vnc Options
Config.Description: Extra options to pass to the x11vnc server running in the Docker container.<br><span style='color: red;'><b>Warning:</b></span> For advanced users. Do not use unless you know what you are doing.

Config.Name: OpenSubtitles Username
Config.Description: Username of your OpenSubtitles (https://www.opensubtitles.org) account. Required to download subtitles.

Config.Name: OpenSubtitles Password
Config.Description: Password of your OpenSubtitles (https://www.opensubtitles.org) account. Required to download subtitles.

Config.Name: Custom Options
Config.Description: Custom arguments to pass to FileBot. This apply to the UI only.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Interval
Config.Description: Time (in seconds) between each invocation of the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Input Stable Time
Config.Description: Time (in seconds) during which properties (e.g. size, time, etc) of files in the watch folder need to remain the same before invoking the Automated Media Center (AMC) script. This is to avoid processing the watch folder while files are being copied.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Action
Config.Description: Action performed by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script on files. Valid values are <b><i>test</i></b>, <b><i>copy</i></b>, <b><i>move</i></b>, <b><i>symlink</i></b>, <b><i>hardlink</i></b>, <b><i>keeplink</i></b>, <b><i>duplicate</i></b> or <b><i>clone</i></b>. Use the <b><i>test</i></b> operation to perform a dry-run and verify that everything gets matched up correctly.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Conflict Resolution
Config.Description: Conflict resolution strategy used by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script. When set to <b><i>skip</i></b>, existing files are never overriden. <b><i>auto</i></b> overrides existing file only if new media is better.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Match Mode
Config.Description: Match mode used by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script. The <b><i>opportunistic</i></b> mode works for all files regardless how badly they are named, while <b><i>strict</i></b> mode works for reasonably well-named files and ignore files that cannot be matched accurately. See <i>https://www.filebot.net/forums/viewtopic.php?t=4695</i> for complete documentation.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Artwork
Config.Description: When set to <b><i>y</i></b>, artwork is fetched and NFO file is generated by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Music Format
Config.Description: Define how music files are renamed by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script. Filebot supports a very powerful naming scheme. See <i>https://www.filebot.net/naming.html</i> for complete documentation.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Movie Format
Config.Description: Define how movie files are renamed by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script. Filebot supports a very powerful naming scheme. See <i>https://www.filebot.net/naming.html</i> for complete documentation.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: TV Series Format
Config.Description: Define how TV series files are renamed by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script. Filebot supports a very powerful naming scheme. See <i>https://www.filebot.net/naming.html</i> for complete documentation.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Anime Format
Config.Description: Define how anime files are renamed by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script. Filebot supports a very powerful naming scheme. See <i>https://www.filebot.net/naming.html</i> for complete documentation.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Process Music
Config.Description: When set to <b><i>y</i></b>, music files are processed by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script. A value of <b><i>n</i></b> does not process them.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Subtitle Languages
Config.Description: Comma-separated list of subtitle languages to download. Example: <b><i>en,de,fr<i><b>.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Custom Options
Config.Description: Custom arguments to pass to the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Input Directory
Config.Description: Directory inside the container used as the input folder of the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Output Directory
Config.Description: Directory inside the container used as the output folder of the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Install Packages
Config.Description: Space-separated list of Alpine Linux packages to install. This is useful when the Automated Media Center (AMC) script is configured to invoke a user-defined script that requires tools not available in the container image. See <i>https://pkgs.alpinelinux.org</i> for the list of available Alpine Linux packages.

Config.Name: WEB Port for GUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI via the web interface.

Config.Name: VNC Port for GUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI via the VNC protocol. Optional if no VNC client is used.

Container.Description:
FileBot is the ultimate tool for organizing and renaming your movies, tv shows or anime, and music well as downloading subtitles and artwork. It's smart and just works.
The GUI of the application is accessed through a modern web browser (no installation or configuration needed on the client side) or via any VNC client. Also, being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small (less than 215MB in download size).
